oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Iron(III) Sulfate as Terminal Oxidant in the Synthesis of Methyl Ketones via Wacker Oxidation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
CHAUDHARI, DA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SUPERCRITICAL CARBON-DIOXIDE
PALLADIUM-CATALYZED OXIDATION
AEROBIC OXIDATION
SELECTIVE OXIDATION
MOLECULAR-OXYGEN
REGIOSELECTIVE OXIDATION
ORGANIC-CHEMICALS
HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE
OLEFINS
ALKYNES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An efficient and environmentally benign method using Fe(III) sulfate as a terminal oxidant in the synthesis of methyl ketones from terminal olefins via the Wacker process is developed. The methodology offers high selectivity for a Markonikov product, shows good functional group compatibility, involves mild reaction conditions, and is operationally simple. Fe-2(SO4)(3) is the sole terminal oxidant in this process. The method holds potential for future applications in organic synthesis.
